III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• It was discussed with the facility that a physical examination should be completed
for each youth entering the treatment program regardless of a physical
examination was completed while the youth was in the detention program.
2

• It was discussed with the facility the importance of developing a system to
calculate the due date of reports to ensure timely completion.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• An electronic copy of the COF rules was provided as requested by the facility.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The facility submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing review period. This involved a special investigation (2023C0000448)
which was the result of staff using an inappropriate behavior management
technique with a youth at the facility. The compliance with the CAP is as follows:
All staff completed the new mandatory trainings before the end of 2023 and training
will continue annually moving forward. The assistant director monitored the training
monthly and provided documentation that this had taken place. Another aspect of
the training was a training on self-care to help avoid staff burning out and this
training took place on 10/26/23. Stress management training also took place on
11/14/23 as did workplace violence de-escalation on 10/10/23. The facility provided
documentation of all of these training being completed, and all staff being involved.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the facility's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Not Applicable
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed all reported a positive experience working at the facility and they
feel very supported by administration. They also reported administration is hands
on and helps whenever necessary. They are receiving training that enhances their
positions and ability to provide the best care possible to the youth.
Three youth were interviewed and all three reported feeling safe at the facility and
well cared for by staff. They reported staff are attentive and always paying attention
3

to youth. They reported staff use de-escalation techniques to assist youth who are
struggling emotionally and will use restraints when a situation becomes unsafe.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility is very well maintained and clean in all aspects. All items required to be
locked are and all items required to be posted are in the appropriate position. The
facility has running water, and all drains are in working order. All fire extinguishers
are up to date.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
